intro: Streptocarpus davyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with contrasting markings. Its leaves are velvety and dark green, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Streptocarpus davyi is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and ability to thrive in indirect light.
